PHOY YLSINIS TV

Mr. S. C. Luk,

224 North Wayne Street,

Angola, Indiana,

ity der Luk:

I deeply appreciate your letter, which reached me this morning.

It is good to hear from you again, though I am more sorry than I can tell 
you that you have had such hard luck lately and have been physically incapace 
itated for your work. Let me congratulate you on your prospects of an early 
recovery, which I trust may be complete. Don't take any chances on bridges

in the lature,

Yes, it is true that I am planning to go abroad in the near future,

as the Trustess have allowed me a year's Leave of absence for this purpose.

I had earnestly hoped that this year wuld furnish me the long desired oppor -
tunity to visit India, where my Lemi, ly lived for fifteen years, and your own

country, where now I feel that I have many triends. Unfortunately the expense 
which auch e trip would involve seems likely to be wholly out of reach oi my 
pocketbook, and I lear that I will here to content myseil with drifting about

Europe,

During my absence ir. Janes C. Sawyer, our Treasurer, vill take charge 
of funda which I have handled heretofore in my agent account. You may therefore 
ramit direct to him in case your father sends you the required funds. Don't let 
the matter worry you, however, for I am satisfied that the obligation will be net 
in due season. Just now you have probably had to face extra expenses, and the

strain must have been a bit severe,

Please accept my heartiest good wishes for the new school year just

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter expressing regret for Luk's injury and stating he will go abroad on a one-year leave. He had hoped to visit India and China, but due to financial contraints, he will be in Europe. James C. Sawyer, Treasurer, will be in charge of funding in the agent account.
